{{also|see|se|Se|sée|seë|sé}} ==Alemannic German== ===Noun=== {{head|gsw|noun|g=m}} # {{lb|gsw|Uri}} {{alt form|gsw|Se}} ===References=== * {{R:Urseren|67}} ---- ==German== {{was fwotd|de|2016|April|17}} ===Etymology=== From {{inh|de|goh|sēo}}, from {{inh|de|gem-pro|*saiwiz}}. Compare {{cog|nds|See}}, {{cog|nl|zee}}, {{cog|en|sea}}, {{cog|da|sø}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/zeː/}} * {{rhymes|de|eː}} * {{audio|de|De-See.ogg|audio}} ===Noun=== {{de-noun|m||Seen}} # [[lake]] #: {{ux|de|Dieser '''See''' ist sehr klein.|This '''lake''' is very small.}} #* "Görlitzer Park", ''Berliner Zeitung'', November 11, 2013. #*: {{quote|de|Auf 14 Hektar gibt es unter anderem einen Kinderbauernhof, mehrere Sport-, Spiel- und Bolzplätze, zwei Aussichtsberge und einen kleinen '''See'''.|There are, among other things, a petting zoo, multiple sporting facilities, playing grounds and soccer fields, two overlooks and a small lake on 14 hectares.}} ====Declension==== {{de-decl-noun-m|s|n}} ===Noun=== {{de-noun|f||-}} # [[sea]], [[ocean]] #: {{syn|de|Meer|Ozean}} #: {{ux|de|Mein Großvater ist als Fischer zur '''See''' gefahren.|My grandfather went to '''sea''' as a fisherman.}} #* Giorgos Christides, "Griechenland empört über Kritik aus Österreich: "Sollen wir die Flüchtlingsboote vielleicht versenken?"", ''Der Spiegel'', January 26, 2016. #*: {{quote|de|Wenn man ein Boot auf '''See''' sichte, gebe es nur eine Handlungsoption.|When one spots a boat at sea, there would only be one way to act.}} # [[sea]], [[sea]] [[condition]], [[swell]] #: {{ux|de|Die '''See''' ist heute sehr ruhig.|The '''sea''' is very calm today.}} ====Usage notes==== * {{sense|sea, ocean}} This sense is normal in compounds and fixed expressions (as above). Otherwise, ''See'' is elevated and usually replaced by the synonym {{m|de|Meer}}. * {{sense|swell}} This sense is very common in nautical parlance but also familiar to ordinary people. ====Declension==== {{de-decl-noun-f|n=sg}} ====Derived terms==== {{der3|de |Seeaal |Seeadler |Seeblatt |Seefahrer |Seefahrt |Seehafen |Seehund |Seeigel |Seekrankheit |Seemacht |Seemeile |Seenot |Seeschiff |Seeschifffahrt |Seeungeheuer }} ===Proper noun=== {{de-proper noun|n}} # A municipality in [[Tyrol]], [[Austria]]. [[Category:de:Austria]] ---- ==German Low German== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|nds-de|gml|sê}}, from {{inh|nds-de|osx|sēo}}, from {{inh|nds-de|gem-pro|*saiwiz}}. Compare standard {{cog|de|See}}, {{cog|nl|zee}}, {{cog|en|sea}}, {{cog|sv|sjö}}. ===Noun=== {{nds-de-noun|g=m|pl=Seen}} # a [[lake]] ===Noun=== {{nds-de-noun|g=f|pl=Seen}} # [[sea]], [[ocean]] #: {{ux|nds-de|Mien Grootvader föhr as Fischer to de '''See'''.|My grandfather went to '''sea''' as a fisherman.}} # [[sea]], [[sea]] [[condition]], [[swell]] #: {{ux|nds-de|De '''See''' is vundaag bannig rohig.|The '''sea''' is very calm today.}} ====Usage notes==== * {{sense|sea, ocean}} Contrary to its German counterpart, ''See'' in Low German is the most common word for ''sea'' and is never replaced by {{m|nds|Meer}} as it is in standard German. * {{sense|swell}} This sense is very common in nautical parlance but also familiar to ordinary people. ====Synonyms==== * {{l|nds-de|Meer}} * {{l|nds-de|Ozean}} ====Derived terms==== {{der3|nds-de |Seeaal |Seeblatt |Seehund |Seemacht |Seefohrt |Seehaven |Seeschipp |Seeschippfohrt |Seeungehüer |seesüük |Seesüük |Seekrankheit }} ---- ==Hunsrik== ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|hrx|/seː/}} ===Noun=== {{head|hrx|noun|g=m|plural|See}} # [[lake]] ===Further reading=== * [https://hunsriqueanoriograndense.wordpress.com/dicionario-werterbuch/ Online Hunsrik Dictionary] ---- ==Luxembourgish== [[File:Hand saw - small.jpg|thumb|eng '''See''']] ===Etymology=== From {{inh|lb|goh|saga}}, from {{inh|lb|gem-pro|*sagō}}. Cognate with {{cog|de|Säge}}, {{cog|en|saw}}, {{cog|nl|zaag}}, {{cog|is|sög}}, {{cog|da|sav}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|lb|/zeː/}} ** {{rhymes|lb|eː}} ===Noun=== {{lb-noun|f}} # [[saw]] ====Related terms==== * {{l|lb|seeën}} ---- ==Pennsylvania German== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|pdc|goh|sēo}}, from {{inh|pdc|gem-pro|*saiwiz}}. Compare {{cog|de|See}}, {{cog|nl|zee}}, {{cog|en|sea}}, {{cog|sv|sjö}}. ===Noun=== {{head|pdc|noun|g=m}} # [[lake]] ===Noun=== {{head|pdc|noun|g=n}} # [[sea]], [[ocean]] ---- ==Tagalog== ===Etymology=== From {{der|tl|nan-hok|-}} {{zh-m|施|tr=Si}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|tl|/siː/}} ===Proper noun=== {{head|tl|proper noun}} # {{surname|tl|from=Min Nan|dot=}} of Chinese origin. ===See also=== * {{l|tl|Sy}} * {{l|tl|Sze}}
